title: 820-3437 no fan, pulsing
message:
The board looks ok, no fan, power supply gives 20-30mA with pulses at 120mA every 3-4 seconds as if it wanted to start but cannot

PP3V42_G3H=3.44V
PPBUS_G3H=8.6V

PP5V_S5=5V
PP3V3_S5=3.3V
PP3V3_SUS=3.3V

PP5V_S4=bursts every 3-4 seconds no readable
PP3V3_S4=bursts every 3-4 seconds at 3.3V
SMC_S4_WAKESRC_EN=0V

PP1V2_S5_SMC_VDDC=1.2V
SMC_BC_ACOK=3.4V
SMC_RESET_L=3.4V

What should I check next?

title: 820-3437 no fan, pulsing
message:
Test in SMC bypass mode first.

Do you get pulse at all big coils?

title: 820-3437 no fan, pulsing
message:
In SMC bypass mode: PPBUS_G3H=8.2V, the fan is spinning half a second, then quarter fan spin, and it starts again half a second, then quarter fan spin... Sometimes the fan is just ticking.

I have pulses on L7520, L7630, L7430, L7310, L7320
No pulses on L3095
3.3V on L7560, 8.2V on L7130

title: 820-3437 no fan, pulsing
message:
Check for pulse at pins 7 & 3 of U1950.
Also check PLT_RESET_L.

title: 820-3437 no fan, pulsing
message: There are pulses of 3.4V at  pins 7 & 3 of U1950, also on PLT_RESET_L

title: 820-3437 no fan, pulsing
message: Q8150 removed, pulse of 3.4V on ALL_SYS_PWRGD, exactly same behaviour in SMC bypass mode, fan is spinning half a second, then quarter fan spin, and repeat

title: 820-3437 no fan, pulsing
message:
Could be bad CPU, or just broken/corroded resistor.

Check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and their traces.
